title: How to Set Up Photo-Based Quoting
description: Let customers send photos for quick estimates without an on-site visit.
requirements: A way to receive photos (text, email, or form)

steps.title: Decide which services qualify for photo quotes
steps.description: Not every job can be quoted from a photo.
substeps: Good for photos: Surface-level work (painting, fencing, landscaping, deck staining)
Sometimes works: Visible repairs, mulching, pressure washing
Usually needs a visit: Electrical, plumbing inside walls, complex HVAC
Make a list of services you can quote from photos
steps.tip: Photo quotes work best for visual, straightforward work.

steps.title: Create a simple submission method
steps.description: Make it easy for customers to send photos.
substeps: Simplest: Give them your phone number for text photos
Better: Create a Google Form that accepts photo uploads
Or: Add a 'Send Photos for Quote' form to your website
Typeform (free tier) makes nice photo upload forms

steps.title: Tell them what to photograph
substeps: Create a short guide: 'For the best quote, please send...'
Include: Wide shot of the whole area, close-up of any problem spots, measurements if possible
Ask for context: age of home, last time work was done, timeline
Add this guidance wherever you request photos
steps.tip: Ask for photos in good lighting. Dark photos = bad estimates.

steps.title: Set expectations about accuracy
substeps: Always say: 'This is an estimate based on photos. Final price may vary after on-site inspection.'
Include: 'Price assumes standard conditions. Complex situations may cost more.'
For big jobs, say the photo quote is a 'range' not a fixed price

steps.title: Respond quickly with a range
substeps: Give a range: 'Based on the photos, this typically runs $X-$Y'
Offer to confirm with a quick site visit
steps.tip: A fast approximate quote beats a slow precise one. You can refine later.

successMessage: You can now give quick estimates from photos! This speeds up your sales process significantly.
proTips: Use ChatGPT's vision feature to help analyze photos and suggest talking points
Save common photo quote templates for similar jobs
